catalogue_raissonne:
Schneiderman 19 iii/v; Harrington 14

Mytton Hall
Schneiderman 19 iii/v
NoXXIV of Etudes à l’Eau-forte 121 x 263
creditline: Gift of Elizabeth, Julie, and Catherine Andrus in memory of John and Marion Andrus
description: tree-lined sidewalk leading to the arched doorway of a large white building; large stone balls flank either side of the path
inscription:
Signature, Date

-- in graphite at lower left on sheet: B8663
-- in graphite on mount: 41953
-- in graphite on verso: 3HK | a46565
provenance: [Kennedy Galleries, New York.] John E. Andrus III, Wayzata, Minn.; by descent to his daughters, Elizabeth, Katie, and Julie; gave to MIA, 2015. Earlier provenances have been gathered, but further research will increase our knowledge of their histories.
signed: signed in graphite, bottom margin, lower right: [Seymour Haden]; signed and dated in plate, lower right: [Seymour Haden 1859]
title: Mytton Hall, From Études à l’Eau-forte, Plate 24
